Package ohos.agp.render.render3d.resources

Class MaterialDesc

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.render.render3d.resources.MaterialDesc

  • public class MaterialDesc
extends Object
    Describes properties of a material.

    Materials can be assigned to objects that are rendered using resource handles. For details, see ResourceManager.

    Since:
    3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  MaterialDesc.MaterialAlphaMode
      Describes available alpha rendering modes of materials.
      static class  MaterialDesc.MaterialType
      Enumerates material types.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int MATERIAL_CLEAR_COAT_BIT
      Specifies whether to use clear-coat parameters to simulate the multilayer material that has a thin translucent layer over a standard layer.
      static int MATERIAL_DOUBLE_SIDED_BIT
      Specifies whether this material is double-sided (disabled by default).
      static int MATERIAL_NORMAL_MAP_BIT
      Specifies whether this material has a normal map enabled.
      static int MATERIAL_SHADOW_RECEIVER_BIT
      Specifies whether this material receives shadows.

    • Field Detail

      • MATERIAL_CLEAR_COAT_BIT

        public static final int MATERIAL_CLEAR_COAT_BIT
        Specifies whether to use clear-coat parameters to simulate the multilayer material that has a thin translucent layer over a standard layer. It is used by setMaterialFlags(int).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MATERIAL_DOUBLE_SIDED_BIT

        public static final int MATERIAL_DOUBLE_SIDED_BIT
        Specifies whether this material is double-sided (disabled by default). It is used by setMaterialFlags(int).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MATERIAL_NORMAL_MAP_BIT

        public static final int MATERIAL_NORMAL_MAP_BIT
        Specifies whether this material has a normal map enabled. It is used by setMaterialFlags(int).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MATERIAL_SHADOW_RECEIVER_BIT

        public static final int MATERIAL_SHADOW_RECEIVER_BIT
        Specifies whether this material receives shadows. It is used by setMaterialFlags(int).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getMaterial

        public GpuResourceHandle getMaterial​()
        Obtains the handle to the material texture. The material texture defines the metallic roughness or specular glossiness depending on the material type set by calling setType(ohos.agp.render.render3d.resources.MaterialDesc.MaterialType).
        Returns:
        Returns the set handle to the material texture if any; returns null otherwise.

      • setMaterial

        public void setMaterial​(GpuResourceHandle material)
        Sets a handle for the material texture. For details, see getMaterial().
        Parameters:
        material - Indicates the GpuResourceHandle object defining the handle to the material texture.

      • getBaseColorFactor

        public Vector4 getBaseColorFactor​()
        Obtains the base color factor of this material. If a base color texture is set by calling setBaseColor(ohos.agp.render.render3d.resources.GpuResourceHandle), the texture values will be multiplied by this factor.
        Returns:
        Returns the base color factor of this material.

      • setBaseColorFactor

        public void setBaseColorFactor​(Vector4 baseColorFactor)
        Sets the base color factor of this material. For details, see getBaseColorFactor().
        Parameters:
        baseColorFactor - Indicates the Vector4 object containing the base color factor.

      • getEmissiveFactor

        public Vector3 getEmissiveFactor​()
        Obtains the emissive factor of this material. If an emissive texture is set by calling setEmissive(ohos.agp.render.render3d.resources.GpuResourceHandle), the texture values will be multiplied by this factor. The factor value ranges from 0.0 (not emissive) to 1.0 (fully emissive).
        Returns:
        Returns the emissive factor of this material.

      • setEmissiveFactor

        public void setEmissiveFactor​(Vector3 emissiveFactor)
        Sets the emissive factor of this material. For details, see getEmissiveFactor().
        Parameters:
        emissiveFactor - Indicates the Vector3 object containing the emissive factor.

      • getAmbientOcclusionFactor

        public float getAmbientOcclusionFactor​()
        Obtains the ambient occlusion factor of this material. If an ambient occlusion texture is set by calling setAmbientOcclusion(ohos.agp.render.render3d.resources.GpuResourceHandle), the texture value will be multiplied by this factor. The factor value ranges from 0.0 (no ambient occlusion) to 1.0 (all ambient occlusion).
        Returns:
        Returns the ambient occlusion factor of this material.

      • setAmbientOcclusionFactor

        public void setAmbientOcclusionFactor​(float ambientOcclusionFactor)
        Sets the ambient occlusion factor of this material. For details, see getAmbientOcclusionFactor().
        Parameters:
        ambientOcclusionFactor - Indicates the ambient occlusion factor to set.

      • getRoughnessFactor

        public float getRoughnessFactor​()
        Obtains the roughness factor of this material, which is used if the material type is set to MaterialType#METALLIC_ROUGHNESS. The factor value ranges from 0.0 (smooth) to 1.0 (rough).
        Returns:
        Returns the roughness factor of this material.

      • setRoughnessFactor

        public void setRoughnessFactor​(float roughnessFactor)
        Sets the roughness factor of this material. For details, see getRoughnessFactor().
        Parameters:
        roughnessFactor - Indicates the roughness factor to set.

      • getMetallicFactor

        public float getMetallicFactor​()
        Obtains the metallic factor of this material, which is used if the material type is set to MaterialType#METALLIC_ROUGHNESS. The factor value ranges from 0.0 (dielectric) to 1.0 (metallic).
        Returns:
        Returns the metallic factor of this material.

      • setMetallicFactor

        public void setMetallicFactor​(float metallicFactor)
        Sets the metallic factor of this material. For details, see getMetallicFactor().
        Parameters:
        metallicFactor - Indicates the metallic factor.

      • getReflectance

        public float getReflectance​()
        Obtains the reflectance of this material.
        Returns:
        Returns the reflectance of this material.

      • setReflectance

        public void setReflectance​(float reflectance)
        Sets the reflectance of this material at normal incidence. The default value is 0.04.
        Parameters:
        reflectance - Indicates the reflectance to set.

      • getNormalScale

        public float getNormalScale​()
        Obtains the normal scale. This is a scalar multiplier applied to each normal vector of the texture. The scale will be ignored if no normal texture is specified. This value is linear.
        Returns:
        Returns the normal scale of this material.

      • setNormalScale

        public void setNormalScale​(float normalScale)
        Sets the normal scale of this material. For details, see getNormalScale().
        Parameters:
        normalScale - Indicates the normal scale to set.

      • getSpecularFactor

        public Vector3 getSpecularFactor​()
        Obtains the specular factor (specular RGB color) of this material, which is used if the material type is set to MaterialType#SPECULAR_GLOSSINESS. This value is linear, and the default value is 1.0, 1.0, 1.0.
        Returns:
        Returns the specular factor of this material.

      • setSpecularFactor

        public void setSpecularFactor​(Vector3 specularFactor)
        Sets the specular factor (specular RGB color) of this material. For details, see getSpecularFactor().
        Parameters:
        specularFactor - Indicates the Vector3 object containing the specular factor.

      • getGlossinessFactor

        public float getGlossinessFactor​()
        Obtains the glossiness factor of this material, which is used if the material type is set to MaterialType#SPECULAR_GLOSSINESS. The glossiness factor defines how glossy (or smooth) a material is. The factor value ranges from 0.0 (completely rough or not glossy) to 1.0 (perfectly smooth or fully glossy).
        Returns:
        Returns the glossiness factor of this material.

      • setGlossinessFactor

        public void setGlossinessFactor​(float glossinessFactor)
        Sets the glossiness factor of this material. For details, see getGlossinessFactor().
        Parameters:
        glossinessFactor - Indicates the glossiness factor to set.

      • getClearCoatFactor

        public float getClearCoatFactor​()
        Obtains the clear coat factor of this material, which is used if MATERIAL_CLEAR_COAT_BIT is set by calling setMaterialFlags(int). The default value is 0.0.
        Returns:
        Returns the clear coat factor of this material.

      • setClearCoatFactor

        public void setClearCoatFactor​(float clearCoatFactor)
        Sets the clear coat factor of this materiel. The default value is 0.5. For details, see getClearCoatFactor().
        Parameters:
        clearCoatFactor - Indicates the clear coat factor to set.

      • getClearCoatRoughness

        public float getClearCoatRoughness​()
        Obtains the clear coat roughness of this material, which is used if MATERIAL_CLEAR_COAT_BIT is set by calling setMaterialFlags(int). The default value is 0.5.
        Returns:
        Returns the clear coat roughness of this material.

      • setClearCoatRoughness

        public void setClearCoatRoughness​(float clearCoatRoughness)
        Sets the clear coat roughness of this material, which is used if MATERIAL_CLEAR_COAT_BIT is set by calling setMaterialFlags(int). The default value is 0.5.
        Parameters:
        clearCoatRoughness - Indicates the clear coat roughness to set.

      • getAlphaMode

        public MaterialDesc.MaterialAlphaMode getAlphaMode​()
        Obtains the alpha rendering mode of this material.
        Returns:
        Returns the alpha rendering mode of this material.

      • setAlphaMode

        public void setAlphaMode​(MaterialDesc.MaterialAlphaMode alphaMode)
        Sets the alpha rendering mode of this material. For available alpha modes, see MaterialDesc.MaterialAlphaMode.
        Parameters:
        alphaMode - Indicates the alpha rendering mode to set.

      • getAlphaCutoff

        public float getAlphaCutoff​()
        Obtains the alpha cutoff value of this material.
        Returns:
        Returns the alpha cutoff value of this material.

      • setAlphaCutoff

        public void setAlphaCutoff​(float alphaCutoff)
        Sets the alpha cutoff value of this material, which is used if the alpha mode is set to MaterialAlphaMode#MASK. The value ranges from 0.0 to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        alphaCutoff - Indicates the alpha cutoff value to set.

      • getMaterialFlags

        public int getMaterialFlags​()
        Obtains the material flags that define the shader variant to be used by this material. The flags can be a combination of MATERIAL_DOUBLE_SIDED_BIT, MATERIAL_CLEAR_COAT_BIT, MATERIAL_SHADOW_RECEIVER_BIT, and MATERIAL_NORMAL_MAP_BIT.
        Returns:
        Returns the flags of this material.

      • setMaterialFlags

        public void setMaterialFlags​(int materialFlags)
        Sets the material flags that define the shader variant to be used by this material. For details, see getMaterialFlags().
        Parameters:
        materialFlags - Indicates the material flags to set.
